definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
"cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 27), occurring in 原, 历, 压 etc
the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
(of one person) to hold the successive posts of/(of several persons) the successive (presidents etc)

sentences.english: It shows how a strong friendship can last through the worst possible times.
sentences.chinese: 这说明一份真挚的友谊可以历苦难而弥坚。

sentences.english: The Tzolk'in is the most important and the one with the most influence.
sentences.chinese: 卓尔金历最重要，是其中一种最有影响力的历。

sentences.english: Hill with thick, which has the final calendar vicissitudes.
sentences.chinese: 山以其厚重，历沧桑而为之雄浑。

sentences.english: Lucky for us we only need to work with three of these calendars.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，我们只需要计算其中三种历。

sentences.english: The first achievement is the "Taichu Calendar" that he made.
sentences.chinese: 第一，就是他编制的历法《太初历》。

sentences.english: First let's have a basic understanding of this calendar.
sentences.chinese: 在这里我们首先来认识一下《太初历》。

sentences.english: Such as that encountered in an almanac .
The ship has missed for six months, or no more can it be salvaged for repair after sinking.
sentences.chinese: 船舶失踪历六个月或沈没不能打捞修复时。

sentences.english: Legia played a game with good commitment.

sentences.english: This calendar algorithms are closely related to cultural exchanges with the Central Plains.
sentences.chinese: 这种历算法与中原文化交流者有密切关系。

sentences.english: From Jin, Yuan to Ming and Qing dynasties, Dongyue Temples were set all around.
sentences.chinese: 历金元至明清，各府州县已普遍建立起东岳庙。

sentences.english: Today, The line of Lishan road is reconstructing, blackout, i could be off duty.
sentences.chinese: 今天，历山路改造，停电，可以休息了。

sentences.english: This means Phaedra may pursue her passion for Hippolytus and offer him the crown of Athens.
sentences.chinese: 所以她可大胆追求希波历踶并赐给他皇冠。

definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
first year of the sixty-year cycle (where each year is numbered with one of the 10 heavenly stems 天干[tian1 gan1] and one of the 12 earthly branches 地支[di4 zhi1])/the sixty-year cycle
Han ethnic group/Chinese (language)/the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
